cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 82 (Friday, May 10, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. SHERMAN:H.R. 8340.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:The constitutional authority on which this bill rests isClause 3 of Section 8 of Article I of the United StatesConstitution; and Clause 18 of Section 8 of Article I of theUnited States ConstitutionThe single subject of this legislation is:Amends the United States Housing Act of 1937 to excludeveteran disability benefits from the definition of annualincome for purposes of eligibility for housing units.[Page H3006]

item.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 613.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Financial Services. H. Rept. 118-726.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Financial Services. H. Rept. 118-726.
Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by the Yeas and Nays: 49 - 0.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held
Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.title: H.R. 8340, Housing Unhoused Disabled Veterans Act
item.description: As ordered reported by the House Committee on Financial Services on May 16, 2024

item.titleType: Short Title(s) as Reported to House
item.title: Housing Unhoused Disabled Veterans Act

To amend section 3(b)(4) of the United States Housing Act of 1937 to exclude certain disability benefits from income for the purposes of determining eligibility for the supported housing program under section 8(o)(19), and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 613.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
